shared_diagnostic_path.reasoning_pattern: Respiratory infection → CXR + severity assessment → pathogen identification

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient presenting with postoperative fever, chest pain that increases on inspiration, and a productive cough, and determine the correct diagnosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports experiencing fever, chills, and a headache starting three days after undergoing an open cholecystectomy. She has a history of an abdominal hysterectomy 16 years ago. She has been smoking one pack of cigarettes daily for 17 years.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Right-sided chest pain that increases on inspiration
Secondary_Symptoms: Productive cough for the last 12 hours

Social_History.Smoking_Status: Current smoker, one pack daily for 17 years

Review_of_Systems.Gastrointestinal: Surgical site below right ribcage, otherwise unremarkable

Respiratory_Examination.Auscultation: Inspiratory crackles at the right lung base

Abdominal_Examination.Inspection: Healing surgical incision below the right ribcage

Chest_X-ray.Findings: Infiltrates at the right lung base

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient presenting with chronic cough, weight loss, and generalized weakness.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports having a fever, cough, weakness, night sweats, and poor appetite persisting for 6 months. He has lost 7.5 kg (16.5 lb) over this period. No history of breathlessness, nasal discharge, nasal obstruction, palpitations, chest pain, or digestive symptoms. Released from prison 9 months ago after a 2-year sentence.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: No significant past medical history reported.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: History of incarceration. No other relevant social history provided.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies breathlessness, nasal discharge, nasal obstruction, palpitations, chest pain, or digestive symptoms.

Chest_Examination.Auscultation: Diffuse crackles throughout the lung fields bilaterally

Ophthalmoscopy.Findings: Three discrete, yellow-colored, 0.5 mm to 1.0 mm lesions with indistinct borders in the posterior pole

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the patient presenting with chronic cough, aching joints, and malaise.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports a chronic cough, aching joints particularly in the hips and lower back, and generalized malaise for the past 2 months. He considered himself in general good health prior to the onset of the cough. He has a known history of hypertension for which he takes clopamide daily along with a multivitamin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Aching joints in hips and lower back

Patient_Actor.Social_History: Non-smoker, occasional alcohol consumer. Describes a hiking trip near Phoenix, Arizona, 4 months ago.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Reports no significant weight loss, no night sweats, and no recent international travel.

Respiratory_Examination.Auscultation: Mild reduction in breath sounds on the right lower side.
Respiratory_Examination.Percussion: Dullness over the right middle lobe.
Respiratory_Examination.Palpation: Mild increased fremitus over the right lower chest.

Musculoskeletal_Examination.Palpation: Tenderness in the lower back and hips.

Imaging.Chest_X-ray: Right-sided consolidation in the lower right lung.

Chest_CT.Findings: Irregular opacity in the right middle lobe measuring 3.8 cm x 3.0 cm, small right-sided pleural effusion, and mild hilar adenopathy.

Lung_Biopsy.Findings: Necrotic granulomatous inflammation with multinucleated giant cells and spherules with endospores.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the patient presenting with a persistent non-productive cough and dyspnea following a recent cold.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents complaining of a persistent non-productive cough and breathlessness that started after a cold about a month ago. Describes previous health as generally good.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia on Hydrochlorothiazide, Lisinopril, and Atorvastatin.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Non-smoker, drinks alcohol occasionally. Recently returned from a month-long trip to St. Louis, Missouri.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: No other symptoms apart from those mentioned.

Chest_Examination.Auscultation: Normal breath sounds without wheezes or rhonchi.
Chest_Examination.Percussion: Mild dullness on the right side.
Chest_Examination.Palpation: Mild crepitus detected on the right side.

Chest_X-ray.Findings: Cavitary lesion in the right lung

Chest_CT.Findings: Confirmation of the cavitary lesion seen on X-ray

Lung_Biopsy.Histopathology: Necrotic granulomatous inflammation with oval yeast bodies within macrophages

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with left chest pain, a productive cough with purulent sputum, and shortness of breath.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports experiencing left-sided chest pain and a productive cough with purulent sputum for the past week. He mentions shortness of breath. States he was diagnosed with influenza recently but did not adhere to the treatment plan provided.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Diagnosed with influenza recently, with non-compliance to treatment. No other significant past medical or surgical history.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Non-smoker, occasional alcohol intake. Occupation and hobbies not specified.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Reports fever and malaise. Denies recent travel, animal exposures, or sick contacts.

Chest_Examination.Inspection: No cyanosis or use of accessory respiratory muscles.
Chest_Examination.Auscultation: Decreased breath sounds at the left base, crackles.
Chest_Examination.Percussion: Dullness to percussion over the left lower lung fields.

Chest_X-ray.Findings: Alveolar infiltrates in the left base with air bronchograms

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with fever, chills, headache, right-sided chest pain, and a productive cough following an abdominal surgery.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports experiencing fever, chills, and a headache three days after undergoing an open cholecystectomy. She mentions right-sided chest pain that increases on inspiration and has had a productive cough for the last 12 hours. She also had an episode of hypotension post-operation that was resolved with IV fluids. Additionally, she had an abdominal hysterectomy 16 years ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Right-sided chest pain that increases on inspiration

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Underwent abdominal hysterectomy 16 years ago for multiple fibroids of the uterus. She has a 17-year history of smoking one pack of cigarettes daily.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: History of smoking one pack of cigarettes daily for 17 years.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Reports discomfort. No other abnormalities noted apart from the symptoms related to her recent surgery and current complaints.

Chest_Examination.Auscultation: Inspiratory crackles at the right lung base

Abdominal_Examination.Inspection: Healing surgical incision below the right ribcage

Chest_X-Ray.Findings: Infiltrates in the right lower lobe consistent with pneumonia
